## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
- [2 Effects](#Effects)
- [3 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

## Description

The scroll of acquirement is a type of scroll that appears in *[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM")* and *[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM")*. When read, the player may acquire an item, which is like wishing except the player can only specify the item class (weapon, armor, scroll etc.) to get.

This scroll has some restrictions to prevent wishing abuse.

- It cannot be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for, you can try but you will just get a [blank scroll](/wiki/Blank_scroll "Blank scroll") in it's place
- It cannot be [written](/wiki/Writing_scrolls "Writing scrolls")
- It cannot be the result of [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling") [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll")
- It cannot be the result of reading a scroll of acquirement
- No role will ever start with this scroll

## Effects

When read, first you must pass a [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") check. If you roll (Luck + rn2(5) < 0), you will fail the roll and lose any possibility of acquiring a new item.

If the scroll is [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed"), nothing will happen.

You are then presented with a prompt of item types. Almost all item types are available except [chains](/wiki/Chain "Chain"), [iron balls](/wiki/Iron_ball "Iron ball"), [venom](/wiki/Venom "Venom"), [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder"), and [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"). Once you select the item class, a random item of that type is generated. There is some post-selection processing that takes place:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- The item will not be an artifact.
- If [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") was generated, it's quantity will be set to 1000 (even though one cannot choose gold, the check is still there)
- If a [magic lamp](/wiki/Magic_lamp "Magic lamp") was generated, it is converted to an [oil lamp](/wiki/Oil_lamp "Oil lamp") with 1500 turns of light.
- If a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") was generated, it is marked as already charged once (1:x)
- If a [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing"), [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph"), or [wand of acquirement](/index.php?title=Wand_of_acquirement\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wand of acquirement (page does not exist)") was generated, the wand type is re-rolled until it doesn't match one of those.
- If a [scroll of wishing](/wiki/Scroll_of_wishing "Scroll of wishing") or *scroll of acquirement* was generated, the scroll type is re-rolled until it doesn't match one of those.

After successful generation, the item is placed on the floor at the player's feet. Apart from the player being able to choose its general type, the item generated in the same manner as ordinary items on the floor.

## Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") mostly follows the the implementation from [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") with a few differences.

Because there are [scrolls of cloning](/wiki/Scroll_of_cloning "Scroll of cloning") in Hack'EM, an additional restriction is that this scroll cannot be cloned.

Uncursed scrolls of acquirement always grant an item, there is no luck involved. Blessed scrolls have a chance at bonus item if your luck is extremely high. Cursed scrolls still do nothing. The acquired item is also put directly into the player's inventory if possible instead of on the floor.

## Origin

The scroll of acquirement appears to originate in [SLASHEM-Extended](/index.php?title=SLASHEM-Extended\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "SLASHEM-Extended (page does not exist)"). [\[2\]](#cite_note-2) It was later ported to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

It may have roots in Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup since there is also an item with the same name that performs a similar function, with the same message.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Unlike the SlashTHEM/Hack'EM version, that scroll is guaranteed to give your character a usable item, and tries to ensure that the item is "good" (high enchantment, matched to player's skills, etc).

## Messages

- You have found a scroll of acquirement!

  You read a scroll of acquirement.

- "Unfortuantely, nothing happens.

  The scroll was cursed or you failed the luck check.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) <https://github.com/Soviet5lo/SlashTHEM/blob/d828e641d341175b5829bef070879bb163c7f636/src/zap.c#L5381>
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) <https://github.com/SLASHEM-Extended/SLASHEM-Extended/commit/671dd27d5160b9a8447de23487bf9fc9dddc3fdc>
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) <http://crawl.chaosforge.org/Scroll_of_acquirement>
